HERO.HEADING: Secure, web-based AI tools for big data speech research
HERO.SUBHEADING: The echolalia project aims to promote data collection, sharing, and analyzing of behavioral data to study language development and/or impairement. \ We focuse on creating community-improved, open-source, state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence tools (hardware and software) to securely store, annotate, analyze and share daylong audio recordings while respecting the privacy of the families and patients.\ Currently, we work on a custom wearable language logger, and a web app using Machine Learning to securely analyze large speech files.

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: The echolalia project aims to promote data collection, sharing, and analyzing of behavioral data to study language development and/or impairment.

We focus on creating community-improved, open-source, state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence tools (hardware and software) to securely store, annotate, analyze and share daylong audio recordings while respecting the privacy of the families and patients.
Currently, we work on a custom wearable language logger, and a web app using Machine Learning to securely analyze large speech files.

The Echolalia Project aims to promote data collection, sharing, and analyzing of behavioral data to study language development in infants. The project focuses on creating community-improved, open-source, state-of-the-art Machine Learning tools to securely store, manage, analyze and share daylong audio and related data while respecting the privacy of the families.

This project rests on an international network of researchers in Europe, America and Asia. It's operational quarters are currently at the Ecole Normale Supérieure in Paris. It has been funded by CNR, INRIA, NSF, ANR, MSR, Facebook and Amazon.

LOGGER.TITLE: Baby Logger
LOGGER.INFO: A small, user-friendly, baby-compatible, wearable audio recorder. It has 4 channels, an accelerometer, 24 hours of recording autonomy, stores up to 120h of data and is encrypted. With the logger comes a set of tools to extract and decrypt the data.

PORTAL.TITLE: Researcher Portal
PORTAL.INFO: A cloud platform for annotating, analyzing and archiving audio data with secure state-of-the-art machine learning tools (signal processing, speech recognition). The data is stored encrypted, the analysis is performed in the cloud itself and can be securely shared and analyzed in situ insuring end-to-end privacy.

DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: We distribute these components in two ways:

ONE.TITLE: Open source code and hardware
ONE.INFO: Both the BabyLogger schematics and code, and the modules of the ResearcherPortal are open source and can be reproduced and modified (MIT open source license, see our GitHub). Contributors are welcome.

TWO.TITLE: Ready to use devices and web service
TWO.INFO: We have setup a non-profit (Echolalia-NP) which distributes at the lowest possible cost, but without putting a non-sustainable burden on the research labs contributing to this project, the Echolalia components for the non-technical savy behavioral scientist. It helps researchers group order BabyLoggers in order to lower the construction price, gives them access to an on-line version of the ResearcherPortal running on a local GDPR-compliant cloud in Europe, and some customer support.

MAIN.TITLE: Our Mission
MAIN.SUBTITLE: Promote collection and analysis of behavioral data for the purpose of behavioral data in order to:
MAIN.ONE: contribute to fundamental research on cognitive development and functioning
MAIN.TWO: contribute to applied research aimed at solving major societal challenges (well-being, education, health, etc.)

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: We help data collection through the building or improvement of secure wearable devices (audio, physiological, images, etc) that enable daylong recording of human interactions and activities in their 'ecological' environments. We help analysis through the development or improvement of annotation software and machine learning algorithms that can be applied at scale in these data. Both sets of technologies are build according to open science and privacy-by-design principles to ensure both maximum reusability, sharability and replicability of the scientific findings and maximum privacy and confidentiality of the participants' data.

ONE.TITLE: Interdisciplinarity
ONE.INFO: We believe that behavioral research and machine learning are engaged in a synergistic, interdisciplinary, collaborative relationship which is going to bring incredible societal and scientific value for education, health and well being, when done right. We strive to help this relationship in the particular instance of early cognitive development, but believe that our model can be exported for other areas of behavioral studies.

TWO.TITLE: Open Science
TWO.INFO: We believe in open, transparent, reproducible, and collaborative science both for data and for algorithms, as is demultiplies the spread of scientific knowledge and its impact on real life problems. This is why we open source all of our tools, and build technology to share data or models across researchers in a secure fashion.

THREE.TITLE: Privacy by Design
THREE.INFO: We believe that parents, families, children, communities participating in behavioral studies should be considered as stakeholders of the process of making scientific progress and therefore treated as partners. This is why, while we build tools to increase data collection volume  and depth of analysis through AI, we counterbalance this  by strenghtening privacy protection and empowering participants with control and insight over their own data.

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: The Laboratory of Cognitive and Psycholinguistic Sciences (LSCP) is located in Paris in the Department of Cognitive Studies of the École Normale Supérieure. The goal of research at LSCP is to understand the psychological mechanisms that underlie the acquisition and functioning of typically human cognitive functions, such as language, social cognition and consciousness.

Integrated into the LSCP, the goal of the Cognitive Machine Learning (CoML) team is to reverse engineer these human capacities, that is to say to develop algorithms that can reproduce certain aspects and test their validity as models of human cognition. The team's activities are centered on speech, language and reasoning.

JOB.POSITION: Junior Engineer in Electronics Hardware / Software

JOBDESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: The objective is to make continuous recordings of infants and their linguistic and visual environment for 1 to 3 years (life-logging), using a system of sensors (audio and photo or video).

The data collected will be made available to the international scientific community for research (study of language acquisition in infants, etc.), while protecting the privacy of parents (and children). An application will allow parents to control the information distributed and will offer services to monitor the child's progress. In the long term, this project will lead to the creation of a “social” start-up that will manage the relationship between parents and the scientific community.

ROLE.PARAGRAPH: Having an already functional prototype, you will have to integrate the different existing functionalities: audio, photos and accelerometer in order to produce a Echolalia Logger at TRL7 level, ready to be tested with volunteer families.
You will need to implement new features: backup to flash memory, wireless communication, data post-processing.
Among other things, you will need to resolve calibration and synchronization issues.
You will have to study the overall consumption of the system, size the battery, and design the circuit allowing its management.
You will have to produce precise technical documents allowing the durability of the Echolalia Logger
You will work in a team comprising a web developer, a student of digital law and a designer in order to take into account all the constraints of the use of data in the design of the prototype.

CANDIDATE.PARAGRAPH: Excellent command of embedded C language. Strong experience in STM and Keil μ Vision IDE microcontroller systems. Mastery of digital communication buses. Experience in data acquisition and processing.
Experience in designing analog / digital circuits. Knowledge of RF protocols. Good knowledge in RF circuit design.

CANDIDATE.SPAN: Knowledge or experience in digital signal processing applied to audio and / or image will be appreciated.
